refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the output of an overloaded function.

listitem.para: a 1-by-1 matrix of strings, the function name.
the point where to compute the function.
the output of the function funname, for the input argument argument x.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function can be used to provide overloading to macros.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.para: In the following example, we overload the acosh function for the variable x, with type "ZDYF4WCD".
refsection.programlisting:
function z = %ZDYF4WCD_acosh(x) v = acosh(x.v) dv = 1 ./ sqrt(x.v.^2-1).*x.dv z = mlist(["ZDYF4WCD";"v";"dv"],v,dv) endfunction
x = mlist(["ZDYF4WCD";"v";"dv"],0.5,0.5); t = overloading_funeval("acosh",x)
refsection.para: In the following example, we define the myoverfun function, which authorizes overloading. If the input argument x is not a matrix of doubles, we check if an overloding function exists. If an overloding function exists, we evaluate this function and return. If not, an error is generated.
